caption: Donald Trump said that he planns to eradicate Section 8 housing, welfare, and Medicaid.

result.explanation: The image contains a sign that says "WE ACCEPT FOOD STAMPS EBT", and shows logos for Visa and Mastercard.  The caption mentions Donald Trump, Section 8 housing, welfare, and Medicaid.  There is no visual evidence in the image to support any of the entities in the caption.

candidates.title: Donald Trump Said: 'Kiss your Section 8, Welfare and Medicaid Goodbye'?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Donald Trump said that he planns to eradicate Section 8 housing, welfare, and Medicaid.
Rating:
False
About this rating
On 9 November 2016, web site FAMMTV published an article (bearing the unquestionably provocative title: "DONALD TRUMP TELL BLACKS "KISS YOUR SECTION 8, WELFARE & MEDICAID GOODBYE") which appeared to report that president-elect Donald Trump said he planned to get rid of assistance programs that are purportedly being abused by "lazy" Americans:
When Donald Trump officially take office, you can expect some major changes. Donald Trump believe Americans became lazy with all of the government assistance programs that the government offer the people. Donald Trump recently said "Americans will no longer be able to be lazy, and depend on the government to take care of them".
Many working American believe a lot of government assistance programs need to be abolished. One of them programs are Section 8. Why do a such program exist anyway? Well Donald Trump doesn't believe in any of it and believe working citizens of America would like to see their tax money being spent in better ways than taking care of able working Americans that simply refuse to. Even though there are working Americans that are on Section 8, 75% of Section 8 recipients go through numerous jobs, and some refuse to work at all.
Another program Donald Trump doesn't believe in is Welfare. Although he openly admitted that he see the point in the program, he don't think Americans understand that if should be used to help those get on their feet instead of a reliable source of income. He believe American need to recreate jobs and recreate American Businesses that other countries are now benefiting from.
The article's lack of any substantiating material should have been a clue that it was not a real story. Had Trump made any sort of divisive or racist assertion of the sort (such as implying that social programs like Section 8 housing exist solely to benefit black people), those comments would have been unquestionably newsworthy in the wake of his upset victory in the 2016 election.
United States presidents are not vested with the power to either create or pass laws on their own:
The president does not have the power to create or rewrite legislation  that is Congresss job. He is not authorized to dispense with or suspend the law. British kings made this practice familiar to the Framers of the Constitution, who deliberately chose to deny such a power to the president ... lets start by referring to the Constitution. Article II charges the president with the duty to carry out the law  to take care that the laws be faithfully executed.
candidates.description: Racially-charged reports that Donald Trump said that he wanted to get rid of specific social programs originated from a hoax news site.

result.explanation: The claim that Donald Trump planned to eradicate Section 8 housing, welfare, and Medicaid is rated as false by Snopes.  Snopes cites a hoax news article as the origin of this claim and points out that the president does not have the power to unilaterally abolish such programs. The evidence directly contradicts the news caption.
result.supporting_points: Source 1 from Snopes rates the claim as False.  The Snopes article explains that the claim originated from a hoax news site and that the president lacks the authority to eliminate these programs unilaterally.

final_result.explanation: The original caption claims that Donald Trump planned to eradicate Section 8 housing, welfare, and Medicaid.  Both internal and external checks strongly refute this claim.  The internal check finds no visual evidence in the provided image to support any of the entities mentioned in the caption. The image shows a store sign indicating acceptance of food stamps and EBT, along with credit card logos; these are completely unrelated to the entities and claims made in the caption.  The external check, using Snopes, rates the claim as false. Snopes' investigation shows that this claim originated from a hoax news site and highlights that the president does not have the power to unilaterally abolish these programs.  There is a significant discrepancy between the image content and the caption's assertions. The image shows a local business accepting food stamps and EBT, which is related to welfare programs, but the caption shifts the focus to a broad political claim about the former president's plans. There is no connection whatsoever between the store's policy and the claim. The high confidence score from the external check (10) is based on the Snopes analysis, a reputable fact-checking source. This aligns with the internal check's confidence score of 0, as there is a complete lack of visual evidence in the image to support the caption's claim.  Combining the results, we can confidently conclude that the caption is out of context.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external checks strongly indicate that the caption is out of context. The image shows a store accepting food stamps and EBT, which has no direct connection to the caption's claim about Donald Trump's plans regarding Section 8 housing, welfare, and Medicaid. Snopes fact-check confirms that the caption's claim is false.
